answers.answer: Yes, heart attacks can last many hours. There are two different kinds of heart attacks and one which is caused by almost but not complete obliteration of flow in a coronary artery can cause smoldering symptoms which are sometimes mis-interpreted and not acted upon with sufficient urgency. Resolution of pain in this scenario also does not indicate relief from the heart attack, as sometimes the heart attack causes death of the nerves which cause the sensation of the heart attack. This is commonly seen in people with diabetes which may not even have signs directly linked to the heart damage.

question: Can one have an "ongoing" heart attack that could last many hours?   For all the information out there about symptoms, nothing I've found indicates if arm or shoulder pain is constant or intermittent, sharp or just an ache, ongoing or definitely gone within a typical amount of time.I posted this on the Medical Communities forum but realize it's more of a doctor question.Thank you.
title: How long do heart attacks last
